title: Ticket #6860: scitokens: parentheses in requirements expr causes submit to fail
description:
The current expected behavior for condor_submit when someone submits a job requiring OAuth tokens is:

  1. condor_submit checks (with the credd) if tokens are available. If they exist, then submit the job. If the tokens don't exist, then...
  2. Send the user to a URL to gather tokens.
  3. After gathering tokens, the user runs condor_submit again on the same job, which goes back to step (1).

It sounds like if there are parentheses in the requirements expression in a submit file that is requesting tokens, something breaks causing condor_submit to never believe that the tokens exist, so the user is always sent to the URL.

Example from Duncan Brown: 

I found a strange edge case in the condor_submit. If I have brackets in requirements, then every condor_submit is a new token request and I can never run a job. Here's my submit file:

> universe = vanilla
>
> output = scitokens_test.$(cluster).$(process).out
> error = scitokens_test.$(cluster).$(process).err
> log = scitokens_test.$(cluster).log
>
> executable = /usr/bin/env
>
> use_oauth_services = scitokens
>
> scitokens_oauth_permissions = xxx
> scitokens_oauth_resource = xxx
>
> requirements = (TARGET.CondorVersion is "$CondorVersion: 8.8.0 Jan 03 2019 BuildID: 457757 PackageID: 8.8.0-1 $")
>
> queue

First submit, I get a request to get a token:

> [dbrown@sugwg-scitokens test_job]$ condor_submit token-test.sub
> Submitting job(s)
> Hello, dbrown.
> Please visit: xxx

I can successfully get the token, now Jeff fixed the sever. But when I resubmit, I thinks the [token requirements] have changed:

> [dbrown@sugwg-scitokens test_job]$ condor_submit token-test.sub
> Submitting job(s)
> Hello, dbrown.
> Please visit: xxx

If I remove the brackets in requirements:

> [dbrown@sugwg-scitokens test_job]$ grep requirements token-test.sub
> requirements = TARGET.CondorVersion is "$CondorVersion: 8.8.0 Jan 03 2019 BuildID: 457757 PackageID: 8.8.0-1 $"

then it works as expected:

> [dbrown@sugwg-scitokens test_job]$ condor_submit token-test.sub
> Submitting job(s)
> Hello, dbrown.
> Please visit: xxx
>
> [dbrown@sugwg-scitokens test_job]$ condor_submit token-test.sub
> Submitting job(s).
> 1 job(s) submitted to cluster 6509687.
remarks:
2019-Jan-17 09:23:44 by jpatton:
I could not reproduce this, neither could Duncan: 

Hi Jason,

Hmmm... Now I can't reproduce the bracket problem either:

[dbrown@sugwg-scitokens test_job]$ condor_submit bracket-test.sub
Submitting job(s)
Hello, dbrown.
Please visit: xxxx

[dbrown@sugwg-scitokens test_job]$ vim bracket-test.sub
[dbrown@sugwg-scitokens test_job]$ condor_submit bracket-test.sub
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 6509699.

I wonder if I somehow munged the permissions when I was manually changing the permissions of the credential file. Let's chalk this up as user error unless I can reproduce it.

Cheers,
Duncan.
